Morphology¶

Functions:

area(roi)

Number of pixels in a segmented region.

average_intensity(roi)

The average of pixel intensities within the segmented region.

eccentricity(roi)

Ratio of the distance between the foci of the ellipse to its major axis length.

extent(roi)

Ratio of the area of the segmented region over the area of the bounding box of the segmented region.

fractal_dimension_lacunarity(roi)

The squared value of the standard deviation of fractal dimension divided by the mean fractal dimension.

fractal_dimension_mean(roi)

The mean value of the fractal dimensions of each pixel in a segmented region.

fractal_dimension_std(roi)

The standard deviation of the fractal dimensions of each pixel in a segmented region.

integrated_intensity(roi, im_itensity)

The sum of the pixel intensities within the segmented region.

major_axis_length(roi)

Number of pixels on the major axis of the fitted ellipse.

minor_axis_length(roi)

Number of pixels on the minor axis of the fitted ellipse.

mitochondria_morphological_class(roi)

The punctate, swollen, and networked morphologies.

orientation(roi)

Angle between the 0th axis (rows) and the major axis of the ellipse that has the same second moments as the region, ranging from -pi/2 to pi/2 counter-clockwise.

perimeter(roi)

Number of pixels in the contour of the segmented region.

radius_max(roi[, return_index])

The maximum distance of any pixel in the segmented region to the closest background pixel.

radius_mean(roi)

Mean value the distances of all pixels in the segmented region to their closest background pixel.

radius_median(roi)

Median value the distances of all pixels in the segmented region to their closest background pixel.

solidity(roi)

Ratio of the area of the segmented region over the area of the convex hull of the segmentation.
flim_tools.morphology.area(roi: numpy.ndarray)[source]¶

Number of pixels in a segmented region.

Parameters

roi (ndarray) – roi of region to copute area

Returns

area – Number of pixels in the mask

Return type

int

Examples

>>> from skiamge.draw import ellipse
>>> import numpy as np
>>> idx_rows, idx_cols = ellipse(20,20, 5,7)
>>> shape_ellipse = np.zeros((40,40))
>>> shape_ellipse[idx_rows, idx_cols] = 1
>>> area_ellipse = int(np.sum(shape_ellipse))
>>> area_ellipse
105

flim_tools.morphology.extent(roi)[source]¶

Ratio of the area of the segmented region over the area of the bounding box of the segmented region.

Parameters

roi (ndarray) – ndarray with single roi.

Returns

extent ratio value

Return type

float

flim_tools.morphology.fractal_dimension_lacunarity(roi)[source]¶

The squared value of the standard deviation of fractal dimension divided by the mean fractal dimension. Lower value represents a dense pattern while higher values represent more open patterns.

flim_tools.morphology.fractal_dimension_mean(roi)[source]¶

The mean value of the fractal dimensions of each pixel in a segmented region. Higher values represent more complex patterns.

flim_tools.morphology.fractal_dimension_std(roi)[source]¶

The standard deviation of the fractal dimensions of each pixel in a segmented region.

flim_tools.morphology.integrated_intensity(roi, im_itensity)[source]¶

The sum of the pixel intensities within the segmented region.

numbe of pixels in the major axis

Return type

int

flim_tools.morphology.mitochondria_morphological_class(roi)[source]¶

The punctate, swollen, and networked morphologies.

flim_tools.morphology.orientation(roi)[source]¶

Angle between the 0th axis (rows) and the major axis of the ellipse that has the same second moments as the region, ranging from -pi/2 to pi/2 counter-clockwise. :param roi: ndarray with single roi. :type roi: ndarray

Returns

Angle between major axis of ellipse and the x-axis.

Return type

float

flim_tools.morphology.perimeter(roi)[source]¶

Number of pixels in the contour of the segmented region.

Parameters

roi (ndarray) – ndarray with single roi.

Returns

number of pixels in perimeter.

Return type

int

flim_tools.morphology.radius_max(roi, return_index=False)[source]¶

The maximum distance of any pixel in the segmented region to the closest background pixel.

Parameters

  • roi (ndarray) – binary roi mask.

  • return_index (bool, optional) – return index of pixel where max radius was found. The default is False.

Returns

Max eucledian distance of roi to background.

Return type

float

Note

If there are multiple, it returns the first instance (see np.argmax)

flim_tools.morphology.radius_mean(roi)[source]¶

Mean value the distances of all pixels in the segmented region to their closest background pixel.

Parameters

roi (ndarray) – binary roi mask.

Returns

mean distance of all the pixel distances to background

Return type

float
